intro: Euphrasia subarctica, commonly known as the Arctic eyebright, is a flowering plant native to northern regions of the Arctic and subarctic. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, characterized by its small, delicate flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in alpine and tundra environments. It produces yellow or whitish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Euphrasia subarctica is adapted to cold climates and has a low-growing habit to survive harsh winter conditions.
